topic.title: Connecting to a Microsoft SQL Server service

ph.i: Windows, .NET, SQL Server, and IIS are either registered trademarks or trademarks of Microsoft Corporation in the United States and/or other countries.

body.p: This document describes how to connect to a Microsoft SQL Server 2012 or 2014 service using the Helion client's tunnel command.
body.note: This document will demonstrate how to connect to a Microsoft SQL Server 2012 instance; the procedure for connecting to a Microsoft SQL Server 2014 service is the same.
body.p: This document contains the following sections:

li.xref: Create a Microsoft SQL Server service instance

ul.li: A Helion Openstack installation, or a Helion Public Cloud account

An ALS cluster with an instance of SQL Server added. This cluster and service is created using the ALS cluster management tool (cf-mgmt) with the following commands:
create-cluster
add-service

section.title: Create a Microsoft SQL Server service instance

li.p: Once the tunneling application is running and bound to the service, you can connect to the service using SQL Server Management Studio.
